intro: Loasa tripartita, commonly known as the three-part loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Loasa tripartita is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
